newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Storm kills four in Bangladesh town.
newsitem.headline: Storm kills four in Bangladesh town.

text.p: At least four people were killed and 25 injured when a storm lashed Rajshahi town in northern Bangladesh on Saturday afternoon, local officials said.
They said winds at more than 100 kph (60 mph) flattened houses, uprooted trees and disrupted electricity. Hundreds of families were made homeless.
Five people died on Friday as storms hit several districts across the country, newspapers reported on Saturday.
More than 100 people were killed and over a million left homeless when a severe storm battered the Bangladesh coast and islands in the Bay of Bengal on May 19.
